**Edited <time datetime="2016-03-09T04:40:38Z" title="03/09/2016 04:40  AM" data-short="8 yr">March 9, 2016</time> by AJTheMighty**
  
ADD THAT 2M ELECTRIC ENGINE AS WELL EVENTUS

![CaoA972.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/CaoA972.jpg?1)

wanted to do some more experiments before I choose a direction. With this one I wanted to see how a smooth transition from a circular profile to a square one would work with the design. It looks a little too simple. One thing I'm trying not to do with this design is make it look too uniform. I want to make sure it looks like an engine that was meant for the vacuum of space. Adding that smooth shape works against me. But hey, that's why I do experiments first ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

![ZZQQxPS.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/ZZQQxPS.png?1)

Although I really like this design, with the outer supports, I don't think it will work for the MPD, because I plan to have a similar structure to support the rows of magnets used for the confinement fields of the fusion engine.

I tried to reproduce the error on my system but I'm on a Mac. Do me a favor, start the game again. When you've loaded the game and are at the space center, press alt f2. This will pull up the debug console. Scroll down and look for any orange text. Take a screenshot and post it here. Then proceed to activate the decoupler. If it crashes, find your log file (it's in the same folder your gamedata folder is in) and post the last 10 or so lines. That will help me tremendously. I checked the debug console on my end, and nothing weird showed up.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-03-10T23:31:12Z" title="03/10/2016 11:31  PM" data-short="8 yr">March 10, 2016</time> by AJTheMighty**

Did a little research into different engines for reaction control systems.   

 R-4D apollo program RCS thruster [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R-4D](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R-4D)

![vZ0Tzhm.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/vZ0Tzhm.jpg)

- Hypergolic (ignites by way of chemical mixture. No ignition) liquid engine.
- NTO / MMH propellant
- [storable](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Storable_propellant "Storable propellant") (non-cryogenic) [propellant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocket_propellant "Rocket propellant")
- Propellant is stored in pressurized tanks. When the tank valve is loosened, both gases mix in a mixing chamber then quickly expand through the nozzle. Simple system. Highly reliable and tanks do not need to be fueled at launch.
- Low thrust

Resistojet [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resistojet_rocket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resistojet_rocket)

![7wR6eaw.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/7wR6eaw.jpg)

- Provides thrust by electrically heating a non reactive propellant
- Small footprint
- Low thrust

SuperDraco [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SuperDraco](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SuperDraco)

![9OOvL39.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/9OOvL39.jpg)

![mFW4jxM.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/mFW4jxM.jpg)

- high-thrust hypergolic engine
- NTO / MMH propellant
- storable (non-cryogenic) propellant
- 73 kn of thrust
- 3d printed

After doing this bit of research (admittedly, I should have done more before jumping into the modeling) I think it would make more sense to model the RCS engines off of the SuperDraco engines seeing as they're the only RCS engines I could find with a comparable amount of thrust required for the Behemoth Payloads. Just not sure how to translate the design into all the different configurations (x4, x3, x2)

EDIT: Updated the rcs quad block

[@Bonus Eventus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/115722-bonus-eventus/) Looks great, but I thinks it could use an extra fifth engine in that ring in the middle

*BUUUUT,* did you choose a final model for the giant ion cluster? If so, you could show me a model of what the colors would look like so we'll get an idea what they'll look like in-game. And also add a Kerbal for scale

And lastly, why not add the second smaller one-nozzle one as an ion engine rather than an XEMT? It could be less expensive that the giant one but adds up to roughly the same price as the giant XEMT's price when clustered in a group of 8 or more ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

A command pod come access ramp would be cool.

[@bazz](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/61364-bazz/) Uhh I have no idea how that would work. Besides, how would you get to the main deck through just a predominantly empty cavity?

[@Bonus Eventus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/115722-bonus-eventus/) how's mod progress going? Let me know if you are working on any major parts of the mod like the ion engine or any bug fixes or whatever ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

There are already hull sections that conform to the cavity a crew compartment variant could easily be created to link the main command pod to the bridge and can also be used to create flat floors. A fuel tank variant would be cool too. 

**Edited <time datetime="2016-03-13T13:01:11Z" title="03/13/2016 01:01  PM" data-short="8 yr">March 13, 2016</time> by bazz**

[@Bonus Eventus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/115722-bonus-eventus/) decided on the final design for the giant ion engine? Any progress on any more parts and the mod in general? If so, you could show us some pics of development or in-game testing?

![30JpzFH.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/30JpzFH.jpg)

![5M8Ckxp.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/5M8Ckxp.jpg)

Upgraded the T404 truss sections. Now I need to give some love to the T202 trusses. The T404 trusses are for large storage (like assent vehicles) kind of like orbital shipyards. The T202 line of trusses have more of a structural focus with modular integrated enhancements, like batteries, antennae, and other devices to augment capabilities. I doubt anyone can guess what those orange structural parts are all about ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

Oh and is it weird that I know EXACTLY what those are for; keeping structural integrity high? And that there's gonna be more T202 parts; can I give some suggestions for some T202 parts; a battery bank, a fuel tank or maybe a compact rotating centrifuge with a counter-rotating wheel - the main ring would be as wide as a standard T404 module - but it would have no windows at all. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

Oh, almost forgot! What's that cap-shaped orange/black part? I have literally no idea what that is whatsoever ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif ":confused:")
